entries: Tocas un objeto de madera de tamaño grande o menor o una sección de madera de no más de 15 pies en cualquier dimensión y le das la forma que te convenga. Así, por ejemplo, podrías dar forma a un gran trozo de madera para convertirlo en un arma, un ídolo o una pequeña cabaña sin amueblar, o hacer un pequeño pasaje a través de una pared, siempre que ésta tenga menos de 1,5 metros de grosor. También puedes dar forma a una puerta de madera o a su marco para sellar la puerta. El objeto que creas puede tener hasta dos bisagras y un pestillo, pero no es posible realizar detalles mecánicos más finos.

spell.name: Acidic Arrow Volley

components.m: one piece of ammunition or one thrown weapon

entries: Lanzas la pieza de munición no mágica o el arma arrojadiza no mágica al aire y eliges un punto de explosión dentro del alcance. Cientos de duplicados de la munición o el arma caen en una andanada desde arriba y luego se esparcen por el suelo. Cada criatura en un cilindro de 40 pies de radio y 20 pies de altura centrado en ese punto debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 8d8} de daño por ácido si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Los cientos de municiones se convierten entonces en pequeños charcos de ácido, haciendo que la zona se convierta en terreno difícil hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

spell.name: Create Construct

components.m: a set of heavy armor for each animated armor, a spool of copper wire, and a dozen gears

entries: Elige un conjunto de armaduras pesadas que hayas reunido. Cada conjunto de armadura pesada se transforma y anima para convertirse en una armadura animada bajo tu control. (El DM tiene las estadísticas del juego para estas criaturas).

Como acción de bonificación en cada uno de tus turnos, puedes ordenar mentalmente a cualquier criatura que hayas animado con este hechizo si la criatura está a menos de 120 pies de ti (si controlas varias criaturas, puedes ordenar a cualquiera o a todas al mismo tiempo, emitiendo la misma orden a cada una). Tú decides qué acción realizará la criatura y hacia dónde se moverá durante su próximo turno, o puedes emitir una orden general, como por ejemplo vigilar una cámara o un pasillo en particular. Si no das ninguna orden, la criatura sólo se defiende de las criaturas hostiles. Una vez dada una orden, la criatura continúa siguiéndola hasta completar su tarea.

La criatura queda bajo tu control durante 24 horas, tras las cuales deja de obedecer cualquier orden que le hayas dado. Para mantener el control de la criatura durante otras 24 horas, debes lanzar este hechizo sobre la criatura antes de que termine el periodo actual de 24 horas. Este uso del hechizo reafirma tu control sobre hasta tres criaturas que hayas animado con este hechizo, en lugar de animar otras nuevas.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over four animated armors. When you cast this spell using an 8th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over six animated armors. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you can animate or reassert control over eight animated armors, or two helmed horrors.

spell.name: Dark Rune of Garamar

components.m: a small blade or sharp object

entries: Rápidamente grabas una runa en la palma de tu mano. La runa comienza a emitir vapor negro y rojo. Extendiendo la mano para exponer la palma, envías una ráfaga de energía vil, formando una línea de 100 pies de largo y 5 pies de ancho en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. La criatura recibe {@damage 6d8} de daño necrótico si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad si tiene éxito.

En cada uno de tus turnos durante la duración, puedes usar tu acción para disparar otra ráfaga de energía de la runa. Cada vez que lo haces, el daño necrótico aumenta un {@dice 1d8} adicional, hasta un máximo de {@dice 9d8}. Sin embargo, el dolor de la runa empieza a hacerse notar. Cada vez que disparas otra ráfaga después de la inicial, recibes {@damage 1d8} de daño necrótico. Este daño necrótico ignora la resistencia y la inmunidad, pero no te obliga a realizar tiradas de salvación de Constitución para mantener la concentración.

spell.name: Gate Guardian

components.m: an entrance made of wood, stone, metal, or other natural materials

entries: Tocas el borde exterior de una entrada, como el borde de una puerta, la abertura de una cueva o un portón. Cuando retiras la mano y das un paso atrás, una criatura emerge del borde de la entrada sin alterar la forma o la estructura de la misma. Esta criatura es una construcción, y está visiblemente hecha del mismo material del que ha surgido, y tiene las estadísticas del bloque de estadísticas de abajo. El tamaño de la criatura está determinado por el tamaño de la entrada de la que está hecha, como se muestra en la siguiente tabla:

rows: 5 pies por 5 pies
Pequeño o mediano
3 metros por 3 metros
Grande
15 pies por 15 pies
Huge
20 pies por 20 pies
Gargantúa

entries: Esta criatura desaparece cuando baja a 0 puntos de vida o es disipada, y es amiga tuya y de tus compañeros mientras dure. Obedece las órdenes verbales que le des (no requiere ninguna acción por tu parte). Si no le das ninguna orden, se defiende a sí misma y a la entrada que creó de las criaturas hostiles, pero no realiza ninguna otra acción.
Cuando la criatura es invocada por primera vez, la entrada desde la que se crea es designada como su punto focal. Mientras dure el hechizo, la criatura no puede alejarse más de 60 pies de la entrada.

spell.name: Investiture of Acid
entries: El ácido recubre todo tu cuerpo, emitiendo vapor del mismo. El ácido no te daña. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Eres inmune al daño por ácido y tienes resistencia al daño por veneno.
Puedes moverte por terrenos difíciles creados por el ácido o los pantanos sin gastar movimiento extra.
El suelo en un radio de 3 metros a tu alrededor está cubierto de ácido y es un terreno difícil para las criaturas que no son tú. El radio se mueve contigo.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear una línea de ácido de 15 pies de largo y 5 pies de ancho que se extiende desde ti en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 4d8} de daño por ácido si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

spell.name: Investiture of Energy
entries: Tanto tu cuerpo como el aire que te rodea vibran y pulsan con {@condition invisible} de energía atómica que perdura durante la duración del hechizo. Estas vibraciones y ondas pulsantes no te dañan. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Eres inmune al daño de la fuerza.
Cualquier criatura que se mueva a menos de 1,5 metros de ti por primera vez en un turno o que termine su turno allí recibe {@damage 1d8} de daño de fuerza.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear una onda expansiva de energía blanca pulsante en un cubo de 30 pies centrado en ti. Las demás criaturas del área deben realizar una tirada de salvación de Constitución o quedar {@condition stunned} hasta el final de su próximo turno, y ser empujadas fuera del cubo en línea recta hasta el espacio desocupado más cercano fuera del cubo.

spell.name: Investiture of Lightning
entries: Un relámpago se arremolina a tu alrededor, partiendo de tu cuerpo, arrojando una luz brillante en un radio de 30 pies y una luz tenue en 30 pies adicionales durante la duración del hechizo. El rayo no te daña. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Tienes resistencia al daño por rayo.
Tu velocidad de movimiento aumenta en 3 metros.

Cualquier criatura que se mueva a menos de 1,5 metros de ti por primera vez en un turno o que termine su turno allí recibe {@damage 1d10} de daño por rayo. Si estás al aire libre en condiciones de tormenta cuando lanzas este hechizo, el daño del hechizo aumenta un {@dice 1d10}.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear un cono de 15 pies de relámpagos brillantes que se extienden desde los relámpagos que te rodean en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en el cono debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 4d6} de daño por relámpago si falla la salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Una criatura que falle su salvación contra este efecto queda {@condition blinded} hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

spell.name: Investiture of Necrosis
entries: Unos zarcillos humeantes de vapor negro cubren todo tu cuerpo. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Eres inmune al daño necrótico y tienes resistencia al daño por frío.
Tu máximo de puntos de vida no puede ser reducido.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear una línea de energía necrótica de 15 pies de largo y 5 pies de ancho que se extiende desde ti en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Una criatura recibe {@damage 4d8} de daño necrótico si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

spell.name: Investiture of Poison
entries: Tanto tu cuerpo como el aire que te rodea se llenan de vapores venenosos durante la duración del hechizo. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Eres inmune al daño por veneno y tienes resistencia al daño por ácido.
Eres inmune a la condición {@condition poisoned}.
Cualquier criatura que se mueva a menos de 1,5 metros de ti por primera vez en un turno o que termine su turno allí recibe {@damage 1d12} de daño por veneno.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear una ráfaga de gas venenoso en una esfera de 15 pies de radio centrada en ti. Las demás criaturas del área deben realizar una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Si fallas la tirada de salvación, la criatura recibe {@damage 4d12} de daño por veneno y queda {@condition poisoned} hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Si la salvación es satisfactoria, la criatura recibe sólo la mitad del daño.

spell.name: Investiture of Radiance
entries: Una energía dorada resplandeciente irradia a tu alrededor, originándose en tu cuerpo, derramando una luz brillante en un radio de 30 pies y una luz tenue en 30 pies adicionales durante la duración del hechizo. Hasta que el hechizo termine, obtienes los siguientes beneficios.

items: Eres inmune al daño radiante y tienes resistencia al daño necrótico.
Eres inmune a la condición {@condition blinded}.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear una línea de 30 pies de energía radiante brillante en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Una criatura recibe {@damage 4d6} de daño radiante si falla la salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Una criatura que falle su salvación contra este efecto queda {@condition blinded} hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

spell.name: Investiture of Thunder
entries: Hasta que el hechizo termine, el aire que te rodea reverbera con una energía atronadora, y obtienes los siguientes beneficios:

items: Los ataques con armas cuerpo a cuerpo realizados contra ti tienen desventaja en la tirada de ataque.
Eres inmune a la condición {@condition deafened}.
Tienes resistencia al daño del trueno.

Puedes usar tu acción para crear un cubo de 15 pies de viento arremolinado centrado en un punto que puedas ver en un radio de 60 pies. Cada criatura en esa área debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Una criatura recibe {@damage 2d10} de daño por trueno si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Si una criatura grande o más pequeña falla la salvación, esa criatura queda {@condition deafened} hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

spell.name: One With the Earth

m.text: a rare gem, geode, or mineral worth at least 100 gp, and thread

entries: Lanzas tus sentidos hacia la piedra que hay debajo de ti, sintonizando con el pulso y el tacto de la tierra cuando la piedra y la roca empiezan a emerger de debajo de tu piel. Mientras dure el conjuro, ganas {@sense tremorsense|MM} en una esfera de 30 pies de radio. También se te considera resistente al daño contundente, cortante y perforante, y no puedes ser derribado {@condition prone} y eres inmune a la condición {@condition petrified}.

spell.name: One With the Wind

m.text: a dozen feathers from either an eagle, a falcon, or a hawk, incense worth at least 100 gp, and thread

entries: Lanzas tus sentidos a la naturaleza, sintonizando con el flujo y reflujo del viento. Si no estás en un área exterior o en un área interior sin vientos naturales significativos cuando lanzas este hechizo, éste falla.

Durante la duración del hechizo, quedas ciego y sordo con respecto a tus propios sentidos, percibiendo en cambio el mundo a través de los vientos dentro del alcance. Puedes ver, oír, oler, saborear o sentir todo lo que está en el exterior, como plantas, animales y otras criaturas, y tienes ventaja en los chequeos de Sabiduría ({@skill Perception}) para detectar cualquier cosa dentro del alcance del hechizo, pero todo lo que está más allá aparece como una pálida niebla blanca.

spell.name: Summon Greater Caterpillar
entries: Invocas a una {@creature massive caterpillar|YAG} que aparece en un espacio desocupado que puedas ver dentro del alcance. La oruga desaparece cuando baja a 0 puntos de vida o cuando el hechizo termina.

La oruga es amistosa contigo y con tus compañeros mientras dure la acción. Tira la iniciativa por la criatura, que tiene sus propios turnos. Obedece cualquier orden verbal que le des (no requiere ninguna acción por tu parte), siempre que no infrinja su alineamiento. Si no le das ninguna orden, la oruga se defiende de las criaturas hostiles, pero no realiza ninguna otra acción.

Si tu concentración se rompe, la oruga no desaparece. En cambio, pierdes el control de la oruga y ésta se vuelve hostil hacia ti y tus compañeros, y puede atacar. Una oruga no controlada no puede ser despedida por ti, y desaparece 1 hora después de que la hayas invocado. El DM tiene las estadísticas de la oruga.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, you can summon an additional massive caterpillar.

spell.name: Wall of Energy
entries: Un muro {@condition invisible} de energía pulsante se conjura en un punto que elijas dentro del alcance. El muro aparece en cualquier orientación que elijas, como una barrera horizontal o vertical o en ángulo. Puede flotar libremente o apoyarse en una superficie sólida. Puedes darle forma de cúpula semiesférica o de esfera con un radio de hasta 6 metros, o puedes dar forma a una superficie plana formada por diez paneles de 6 metros por 6 metros. Cada panel debe ser contiguo a otro. En cualquier forma, el muro tiene un grosor de 1/4 de pulgada. Dura lo que dura. Si el muro atraviesa el espacio de una criatura cuando aparece, la criatura es empujada hacia un lado del muro (a tu elección qué lado), y debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Si falla la tirada de salvación, el objetivo recibe {@damage 8d6} de daño de fuerza, o la mitad si tiene éxito la tirada de salvación.

Nada puede atravesar físicamente el muro. Es inmune a todo el daño y no puede ser disipado por magia de disipación. Si una criatura lanza el hechizo desintegrar o un hechizo de quantum que inflige daño de fuerza contra el muro, debes hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución para el muro, ignorando cualquier ventaja o desventaja que puedas tener en la tirada. Si fallas la tirada de salvación, el muro se desvanece. El muro también se extiende al Plano Etéreo, bloqueando el viaje etéreo a través del muro.

spell.name: Wall of Flesh

components.m: a piece of flesh and a finger bone

entries: Un muro no mágico de carne, rostros y extremidades se conjura en un punto que eliges dentro del alcance. Cada rostro del muro gime o grita constantemente de dolor. El muro tiene 15 centímetros de grosor y está compuesto por diez secciones de carne y huesos de 3 metros por 3 metros. Cada sección debe ser contigua con al menos otro panel, cosido. Como alternativa, puedes crear secciones de 10 por 20 pies que sólo tengan 3 pulgadas de grosor.

Si el muro atraviesa el espacio de una criatura cuando aparece, ésta es empujada hacia un lado del muro (a tu elección). La parte interior de la pared es una piel lisa, mientras que la parte exterior de la pared consiste en brazos móviles, deja y caras incrustadas en la pared. Si una criatura estuviera rodeada por todos los lados por el muro (o por el muro y otra superficie sólida), esa criatura puede hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Si tiene éxito, puede usar su reacción para moverse hasta su velocidad de modo que ya no esté rodeada por el muro.

El muro puede tener cualquier forma que desees, aunque no puede ocupar el mismo espacio que una criatura u objeto. No es necesario que el muro sea vertical ni que se apoye en ningún cimiento firme. Sin embargo, debe fundirse con el terreno existente y estar sólidamente apoyado en él. Así, puedes utilizar este hechizo para salvar un abismo o crear una rampa.
Si crea un vano de más de 6 metros de longitud, debe reducir a la mitad el tamaño de cada sección para crear soportes.

El muro es un objeto de carne que puede ser dañado y, por tanto, atravesado. Cada sección tiene CA 14 y 40 puntos de golpe por pulgada de grosor. Reducir un panel a 0 puntos de golpe lo destruye y puede hacer que los paneles conectados se rompan entre sí a discreción del DM.

Siempre que una criatura comience su turno o se mueva a menos de 3 metros de la parte exterior del muro, esa criatura debe hacer una tirada de salvación de destreza. Si falla la tirada de salvación, el muro agarra a la criatura y ésta queda {@condition restrained}. La criatura puede usar su acción para repetir la tirada de salvación, terminando el efecto si tiene éxito. Mientras una criatura está {@condition restrained}, puedes usar tu acción de bonificación para hacer que las manos o las caras del muro golpeen o muerdan a la criatura, infligiendo {@dice 3d8} de daño contundente y {@damage 3d8} de daño perforante.
Si una criatura de carne muere por un ataque realizado por el muro, el cuerpo de esa criatura es absorbido y añadido al muro.

spell.name: Wall of Iron

components.m: a piece of iron ore or a handful of iron pieces

entries: Un muro no mágico de hierro forjado surge a la existencia en un punto que elijas dentro del alcance. El muro tiene 15 centímetros de grosor y está compuesto por diez paneles de 3 metros por 3 metros. Cada panel debe ser contiguo con al menos otro panel. Alternativamente, puedes crear paneles de 10 pies por 20 pies que sólo tengan 3 pulgadas de grosor.

Si el muro atraviesa el espacio de una criatura al salir, ésta es empujada hacia un lado del muro (a su elección). Si una criatura estuviera rodeada por todos los lados por el muro (o el muro y otra superficie sólida), esa criatura puede hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Si tiene éxito, puede usar su reacción para moverse a su velocidad y dejar de estar rodeada por el muro.

El muro puede tener cualquier forma que desees, aunque no puede ocupar el mismo espacio que una criatura u objeto. El muro no necesita ser vertical ni apoyarse en ninguna base firme. Sin embargo, debe fundirse con la piedra existente y apoyarse sólidamente en ella. Así, puedes utilizar este hechizo para salvar un abismo o crear una rampa.
Si crea un tramo de más de 6 metros de longitud, debe reducir a la mitad el tamaño de cada panel para crear soportes. Puedes dar forma a la pared para crear almenas, almenas, etc.

El muro es un objeto de piedra que puede ser dañado y, por tanto, atravesado. Cada panel tiene CA 17 y 50 puntos de vida por cada pulgada de grosor. Reducir un panel a 0 puntos de golpe lo destruye, y el metal se oxida y puede hacer que los paneles conectados se derrumben a discreción del DM.
Si mantienes la concentración en este hechizo durante toda su duración, el muro se convierte en permanente y no puede ser disipado. De lo contrario, el muro desaparece cuando el hechizo termina.

spell.name: Wall of Wood

components.m: a handful of pieces of bark

entries: Creas un muro de troncos de madera fuertes, duraderos y en movimiento, adornados con gruesas ramas, hojas y raíces. El muro aparece dentro del alcance de una superficie sólida y dura lo que dura. Eliges hacer el muro de hasta 60 pies de longitud, 10 pies de altura y 5 pies de grosor o un círculo de 20 pies de diámetro y hasta 20 pies de altura y 5 pies de grosor. El muro bloquea la línea de visión.

Cuando el muro aparece, cada criatura dentro de su área debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Si falla la tirada de salvación, la criatura recibe {@damage 7d8} de daño por apaleamiento, o la mitad de daño si la tirada de salvación tiene éxito.

Una criatura puede moverse a través del muro, aunque de forma lenta y dolorosa. Por cada 1 pie que una criatura se mueva a través del muro, debe gastar 4 pies de movimiento. Además, la primera vez que una criatura entra en el muro en un turno o termina su turno allí, la criatura debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Recibe {@damage 7d8} de daño por apaleamiento si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad si tiene éxito.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Alice's Colossal Cannon

components.m: a handful of flammable powder and a piece of flint

entries: Conjuras un enorme cañón en un cubo de 15 por 15 pies en un área desocupada que puedes ver. El cañón es visiblemente mágico, y rayas etéreas de energía arcana tejen a su alrededor. El cañón emite un zumbido bajo y audible que reverbera por todo el suelo que se extiende a 15 pies del cañón. Elige un tipo de daño entre ácido, frío, fuego, rayo, veneno o trueno. Una ráfaga del tipo de daño apropiado que forma una línea de 500 pies y 15 pies de ancho sale disparada del cañón. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 12d6} de daño si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad si tiene éxito. Las criaturas que fallan su tirada de salvación también son empujadas hacia atrás 30 pies.

El tipo de daño también afecta a la zona. El fuego y los rayos encienden los objetos inflamables de la zona que no se llevan puestos ni se transportan. El frío cubre los objetos de la zona con una capa de escarcha. El ácido y el veneno cubren los objetos de la zona con una capa de líquido ácido y venenoso. El trueno hace que los objetos del área que no se lleven puestos o sean transportados vuelen hacia atrás 60 pies.
Este hechizo inflige el doble de daño contra las estructuras.

spell.name: Black Lightning
entries: Una temible tormenta compuesta por inquietantes relámpagos negros aparece en un lugar que elijas dentro de su alcance. El área de la tormenta consta de hasta diez cubos de 3 metros, que puedes organizar como quieras. Cada cubo debe tener al menos una cara adyacente a la cara de otro cubo. Cada criatura en el área debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Las criaturas que lleven armadura metálica o estén hechas de metal hacen esta tirada de salvación con desventaja. Reciben {@damage 3d10} de daño por rayo y {@dice 3d10} necrótico si fallan la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tienen éxito. Una criatura que falle su tirada de salvación se ve envuelta en un rayo negro, lo que le provoca un {@condition stunned} hasta el comienzo de su siguiente turno.
El rayo daña los objetos que se encuentran en la zona y enciende los objetos inflamables que no se llevan puestos ni se transportan.

spell.name: Manastorm
entries: Una enorme tormenta púrpura y azul de 15 pies de altura llena de relámpagos rosas y dorados aparece y se arremolina en un radio de 40 pies centrado en un punto que puedas ver dentro del alcance. El punto debe estar centrado a 15 pies del suelo.

Hasta que el hechizo termine, el área dentro y debajo de la manastorm se considera terreno difícil, y cualquier criatura que comience su turno allí o se mueva a través del área afectada debe tener éxito en una tirada de salvación de Fuerza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 10d8} de daño de fuerza si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Si una criatura intenta lanzar un hechizo mientras se encuentra en el área afectada, esa criatura debe tener éxito en un chequeo de {@skill Arcana} contra su DC de salvación de hechizos. En caso de fallar la salvación, el hechizo se marchita y la ranura de hechizo se gasta como si se hubiera lanzado.

spell.name: Nivek's Grand Artillery

m.text: four 3-inch hollow iron tubes, each inlaid with silver worth at least 1,000 gp a piece

entries: Utilizando los tubos de hierro, conjuras cuatro enormes cañones, cada uno de los cuales emerge del suelo en cuatro lugares que elijas dentro de su alcance. El área de cada cañón consiste en un cubo de 20 pies, que puedes disponer como quieras. Cada cañón dispara una ráfaga formando una línea de 1.000 pies de largo y 10 pies de ancho que sale del cañón en la dirección que elijas. Puedes elegir una dirección diferente para cada cañón. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Destreza. Una criatura recibe {@damage 8d8} de daño por fuego si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

En los turnos siguientes, puedes utilizar tu acción para mantener este efecto, disparando cualquier número de cañones una vez como parte de la misma acción. Como acción adicional en cada uno de tus turnos, puedes girar cada cañón para orientarlo en una nueva dirección, aunque no puedes mover los cañones del lugar donde fueron invocados. Sin embargo, el efecto termina si te alejas más de 6 metros de al menos uno de los cañones.

Estas ráfagas de cañón infligen el doble de daño a los objetos y estructuras. La explosión de cada cañón daña los objetos de la zona y enciende los objetos inflamables que no se lleven puestos o se transporten.

spell.name: Particle Beam

components.m: a pinch of dust and a 1-inch sphere made of polished metal

entries: Un rayo de luz blanca condensada que emite un ruido bajo formando una línea de 100 pies de largo y 5 pies de ancho sale de ti en la dirección que elijas. Cada criatura en la línea debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución. Una criatura recibe {@damage 10d6} de daño de fuerza si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito. Si este daño reduce al objetivo a 0 puntos de vida, queda desintegrado.

Una criatura desintegrada y todo lo que lleva puesto y en la mano, excepto los objetos mágicos, quedan reducidos a la nada. La criatura sólo puede volver a la vida mediante una resurrección verdadera o un hechizo de deseo.

Este hechizo desintegra automáticamente un objeto no mágico mediano o menor o una creación de fuerza mágica. Si el objetivo es un objeto o creación de fuerza Enorme o mayor, este hechizo desintegra una porción de 5 pies cúbicos del mismo. Un objeto mágico no se ve afectado por este hechizo.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot above 7th.

spell.name: Salvage Ship

m.text: the wreckage of a ship, which the spell consumes

entries: Envías gradas de energía mágica hacia los restos de un naufragio. El barco y cualquier pieza del mismo, como partes del casco, velas, mástiles, barandillas y demás, comienzan a flotar hacia la superficie, si está sumergido en el agua, de lo contrario el barco y las piezas del mismo comienzan a reconstruirse juntos. Durante esta reconstrucción, la madera podrida o destruida se transforma en madera nueva, y las velas desgarradas se reparan solas. Este hechizo repara cualquier contenedor, cuerda o ventana que sea necesaria para el viaje y la funcionalidad del barco, aunque este hechizo no restaura ninguna carga que el barco llevara en el momento de naufragar.
El tiempo necesario para lanzar este hechizo depende del tamaño del barco.

rows: Raft
1 minuto
Barco de remos
1 minuto
Barco de quilla
10 minutos
Longship
1 hour
Barco de vela
2 horas
Buque de guerra
3 horas
Galeón
4 horas

entries: Al final de la duración del hechizo, el barco descansa en la superficie de una masa de agua o en una playa, y el barco está perfectamente intacto. Un barco restaurado mediante este hechizo no puede ser disipado hasta convertirse en un naufragio, aunque el barco puede ser destruido o dañado por medios normales. Cualquier efecto mágico que estuviera en el barco en el momento de su naufragio tampoco se restaura.

spell.name: Steal Voice

m.text: a small box and a gem worth at least 100 gp

entries: Intentas robar la voz de otra criatura. Elige una criatura dentro del alcance para hacer una tirada de salvación de Sabiduría. Si falla la tirada de salvación, la criatura pierde su voz, que queda atrapada en una caja. Una criatura que tenga éxito en su salvación es inmune a este hechizo durante 1 hora, y una criatura que no pueda emitir sonidos vocales o hablar es inmune a este hechizo.
Sólo puedes tener una voz almacenada en la caja a la vez. La caja tiene una CA de 16 y 10 puntos de vida.
Mientras la criatura esté afectada por este hechizo, no podrá hablar ni lanzar hechizos que requieran un componente verbal.

Siempre que hables, puedes elegir abrir la caja e imitar la voz que hay dentro. Una criatura que te escuche hablar con esta voz puede saber que no eres el orador original con un chequeo de Sabiduría ({@skill Insight}) exitoso opuesto por tu DC de salvación de hechizos. Una criatura tiene ventaja en su chequeo si puede verte.

Una criatura afectada por este hechizo puede repetir la tirada de salvación al final de su turno. Si la tirada de salvación tiene éxito, la criatura puede recuperar su voz. Alternativamente, una criatura puede intentar coger o romper la caja. Si la caja se abre o se destruye, la criatura afectada por este hechizo recupera inmediatamente su voz.

spell.name: Superposition

m.text: a handful of fine grey dust and a gem worth at least 1000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: Creas tres duplicados de ti mismo que aparecen en tu espacio. Cada duplicado es una criatura, parcialmente real y formada por energía y materia pulsante, y puede realizar acciones y verse afectada como una criatura normal. Parece ser igual que tú, sin embargo, tus puntos de golpe se dividen entre ti y cada duplicado, y tanto tú como cada duplicado tienen un cuarto de tu punto de golpe máximo. Además, cada duplicado se forma con un equipo menor, es decir, cualquier ropa o armadura no mágica, así como un arma no mágica, como un báculo o una daga. Por lo demás, cada duplicado utiliza todas sus estadísticas. Puedes usar tu acción para descartar los duplicados ilusorios. El hechizo termina cuando los tres duplicados son destruidos o la duración termina.

Cada duplicado es amigo tuyo y de las criaturas que designes. Obedece tus órdenes habladas, moviéndose y actuando de acuerdo con tus deseos y actuando en tu turno de combate. Tú y cada duplicado compartís vuestras ranuras de hechizo y vuestra lista de hechizos. Por ejemplo, si un duplicado gasta una ranura de hechizo de 1er nivel, tú y cada uno de los otros duplicados tratan esto como si cada uno de ustedes hubiera gastado la ranura de hechizo.

El duplicado dura hasta que baja a 0 puntos de vida, momento en el que estalla en polvo. Si vuelves a lanzar este hechizo, cualquier duplicado activo que hayas creado con este hechizo se destruye al instante.

spell.name: Yune's Find Greater Familiar

m.text: 500 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a silver or golden brazier

entries: Obtienes el servicio de un familiar, un espíritu que adopta la forma de una bestia de CR 5 o inferior. El familiar aparece en un espacio desocupado dentro del alcance, y el familiar tiene las estadísticas de la forma elegida, aunque se considera un celestial, fey o fiend (tu elección) en lugar de una bestia.

Tu familiar actúa independientemente de ti, pero siempre obedece tus órdenes. En combate, el familiar tira su propia iniciativa y actúa por su cuenta. Un familiar puede atacar y realizar otras acciones de forma normal.

El familiar también obtiene los siguientes beneficios: la puntuación de Inteligencia del familiar aumenta hasta 14, si es inferior, el familiar obtiene un nombre de su elección, y el familiar es capaz de hablar y leer todos los idiomas que el lanzador es capaz de hablar, leer y escribir. El familiar no puede escribir a menos que tenga los apéndices para hacerlo. El familiar adquiere una personalidad básica, y su conciencia siempre es invocada en la nueva forma cada vez que se lanza este hechizo. El familiar también puede interactuar con los objetos de una manera que tenga sentido lógico para su forma.

El familiar también puede sintonizar con un objeto mágico a la vez, y este objeto aparece y desaparece con él cuando es invocado o despedido. Si despides a tu familiar para siempre, el objeto se te devuelve.

Cuando el familiar baja a 0 puntos de vida, desaparece en una bocanada de humo, sin dejar ninguna forma física, y reaparece después de que vuelvas a lanzar este hechizo. Mientras tu familiar esté en el mismo plano de existencia que tú, puedes comunicarte con él telepáticamente. Además, como acción, puedes ver a través de los ojos de tu familiar y escuchar lo que oye hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno, obteniendo los beneficios de cualquier sentido especial que tenga el familiar. Durante este tiempo, eres sordo y ciego con respecto a tus propios sentidos.

Como acción, puedes despedir temporalmente a tu familiar, que desaparecerá en una dimensión de bolsillo donde te espera para que lo invoques. También puedes descartarlo para siempre. Mientras está temporalmente despedido, puedes hacer que reaparezca en cualquier espacio desocupado a menos de 30 pies de ti.

You can't have more than on familiar at any given time. If you have a familiar already by means of the find familiar spell, you must dismiss the familiar granted by the find familiar spell. You can only have the familiar from find familiar or from this spell active at a time, and you cannot have both. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms of a beast of CR 5 or lower. The familiar then transforms into the new chosen form.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch or a spell with a range of 30 feet or less, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 150 feet of you to do so, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll, and if the spell requires a saving throw, you use your spell save DC for the spell.

spell.name: Yune's Staff

m.text: a 1 foot rod made of a rare treated wood, inlaid with silver or golden runic inscriptions worth 200 gp

entries: You transform the wooden rod into a mighty staff that pulses with magical energy in your hand. This magic quarterstaff lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 3d10} force damage on a hit and has the versatile properties, and the staff deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage on when wielded with two hands. In addition, for the spell's duration, while the staff is in your hand your movement speed and jump height are doubled, and you can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra {@action Attack}, that gives you extra attacks.

If you drop the weapon, it vanishes at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the wooden rod to reappear in your hand before growing back into a full quarterstaff.

spell.name: Atomic Particle Devastation

components.m: a handful of grey dust and a small metal ring worn on one hand

entries: Incredible white light flashes as atomic energy gathers in a 60-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that cube must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 14d6} force damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
If damage from this spell reduces a target to 0 hit points, the target and all of its nonmagical equipment and clothing that it is wearing and carrying are turned into fine grey dust.

spell.name: Kleiber's Arcane Tower

components.m: an ornate key made of bone, crystal, ivory, metal, or wood

entries: You conjure a nine-story tower made of crystal, ivory, stone, wood, or similar suitably sturdy materials. This spell immediately fails if there is not enough room for the tower. The tower can be round, square, or triangular in shape. Each level of the tower is 10 feet tall and has an area of up to 90 square feet. Access between the different floors and levels can consist of a simple ladder and hatch, a stairwell, or small teleportation circles that lead to the room of your choice. Each level takes one of the following forms, chosen by you when you cast the spell:
A master bedroom with a bed, chairs, chest, personal bathtub and wash station, and magical fireplace that never goes out.
A study with desks, books, bookshelves, parchments, ink, ink pens, quills, and other academic instruments.
A dining space with a table, chairs, magical fireplace, containers, and cooking utensils.
A kitchen space with an oven, table, stools, cooking utensils, and raw ingredients, such as spices, herbs, vegetables, fruit, and grains that replenish upon the next casting of this spell.
A lounge with couches, armchairs, side tables and footstools.
A washroom with toilets, wash tubs, a magical brazier, and sauna benches.
An observatory with a telescope, maps of the night sky, and other astronomical instruments.

An indoor garden, filled with common ingredients and plants, a table with an alchemy set and Alchemist's Supplies, a small fountain or stream, small glowing crystals throughout the garden, and several small woodland beasts or insects that live in the garden. A bedroom filled with up to six beds and chests, a wardrobe, and a fire place.
A storage cellar filled with wine racks of simple wines, crates, barrels, and plain chests.
An open roof with a small table, chairs, and a brazier or large crystal that constantly emits a warm light within a 20-foot radius from the center of the roof.

The layout of the rooms can take any order that you wish, however the rooftop always remains the highest. The interior of the tower is warm and dry, regardless of conditions outside. Any equipment or furnishings conjured with the tower dissipate into smoke if removed from it. At the end of the spell's duration, all creatures and objects within the tower that were not created by the spell appear safely outside on the ground, and all traces of the tower and its furnishings disappear. Any equipment or objects that were taken into the tower can be left safely within the tower's rooms, and remain in the place they were left until the next casting of this spell. Objects left within the tower that were not conjured within the tower as part of the casting of this spell can be safely taken out of the tower.

When you first cast this spell, you and creatures of your choice can enter the tower and a 20-foot-radius area outside of the tower. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. By means of this spell, the tower can be hidden away, safe from detection for the duration. When you cast the spell, you can choose to have the tower become {@condition invisible} to creature you do not allow inside, it becomes {@condition invisible} and can't be targeted by divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors created by the divination of spells. You always know the exact location of the tower, and you can never be barred from entering your own tower.

You can set a condition for a creature to find and locate the tower. The condition can be anything you choose, but it must occur or be visible within 1 mile of the target. Examples include a specific password or phrase that must be said. You can change the password needed to see and enter the tower by spending 10 minutes in meditation within the tower.

While you are within the tower, if you cast the unseen servant, tiny servant, or animate objects spell, you can choose to have the beige you create become permanent, so long as they remain within the tower. You can have only one of these spells remain permanent within the tower at a time, and they appear along with the tower when you cast this spell to summon the tower again. Each servant you create can move freely within the tower and the 20-foot radius surrounding the tower. For the unseen servant spell, you can choose to have it become seen and take a form of your choice. It's Intelligence becomes 10, and it can speak, read, and write each language that you know. It gains a simple personality, such as cheerful, gloomy, lethargic, energetic, or playful.

You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the tower's existence for another 24 hours. You can create a permanent tower by casting this spell in the same location and with the same configuration every day for one year. When the tower becomes permanent, you can choose to keep the tower under the effects of being hidden away permanently, or can choose to have this feature become activated on your command.

spell.name: Quantum Entrapment

components.m: a pinch of fine grey dust and a small 1-inch circle of glass

entries: You cause the air around a creature that you can see within range to pulse and vibrate rapidly before watching them quickly shrink down to the microscopic level, causing them to enter into a subatomic realm. The target remains there for the duration or until it can escape.

While in the subatomic realm, the creature sees atoms and other microscopic matter float by them. A creature in this state is immune to all attacks and spells, and attempts made to locate them via divination spells fail.

The target can use its action to attempt to break free of the spell and escape. When it does so, it makes a DC 20 Constitution check. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends. If the creature fails, it takes {@damage 8d8} force damage, as it is bludgeoned by atomic matter.
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Red Lightning

m.text: a metal ring embedded with a ruby worth at least 5,000 gp

entries: You summon forth from above a massive bolt of crackling red lightning to strike an area within range. Each creature within in a 30-foot sphere of the point of impact must make a Constitution saving throw. Water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage at the beginning of each of their turns for the next minute. A creature can repeat their saving throw, ending this effect on a successful save.
The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

spell.name: Svartureldur
entries: Your eyes briefly flash with bright red light before cold, black flames silently wreath around one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. It takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage and {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target is cursed and also burns for the spell's duration. The curse causes the burning target‘s speed to be reduced to 0, and the creature must spend its each of its subsequent turns writhing in pain. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished through both magical and nonmagical means. A remove curse spell cast with a spell slot of 7th level or higher ends this effect.
If damage from this spell reduces a target to 0 hit points, the target is turned to blackened ash.

spell.name: Yune's Transformation

components.m: a drop of your own blood

entries: You infuse your body with magical strength from the Weave itself, granting you incredible speed and strength. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: Your eyes glow brightly in a color of your choice.
You gain 100 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with unarmed attacks.

When you hit a target with an unarmed melee attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 4d12} damage of one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder. You may only use one damage type for the spell's duration.
You have proficiency in Dexterity and Constitution saving throws.
Whenever you first cast this spell, the area in a 15-foot radius around you cracks and splinters, making it difficult terrain for 1 hour.
Your attacks deal double damage to objects and structures.

You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra {@action Attack}, that gives you extra attacks.

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Black Hole
entries: A black hole of powerful gravitational energy fills a 15-foot sphere on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, the pulsating energy of the black hole turns the ground within a 60-foot radius area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 12d8} force damage and be {@condition restrained} by the gravitational pull until the spell ends, and the creature is pulled 30 feet towards the black hole. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the gravitational pull takes {@damage 6d8} force damage, and is pulled 30 feet towards the black hole.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the gravitational pull can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
If a creature is pulled to within 5 feet of the black hole, it must make another Strength saving throw or become pulled into the Astral Plane until the spell ends.

spell.name: Charge of the Final Company

m.text: a gem inlaid warhorn that is worth at least 2500 gp

entries: You emit a battle cry through the warhorn, as 100 spectral humanoid soldiers appear in an unoccupied 50-foot-by-50-foot square area that you can see. These soldiers appear armed and ready for combat, and speak only when you address them.

When this company is summoned, you then order them to charge forward up to 100 feet. Each creature or object in the charging company's path must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} force damage, or half as much on a successful one, as the company attacks . A creature who fails their saving throw is knocked {@condition prone} until the beginning of their next turn.
The company damages objects in the area

spell.name: Descent of Blades

components.m: a dagger and a piece of cotton

entries: You conjure forth hundreds of swords, spears, daggers, pikes, and other sharp weaponry to descend towards the ground in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is also knocked {@condition prone} by the downpour of weaponry. The weapons are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.
The weapons stick out of the ground and structures, turning the area of effect into difficult terrain until cleared.

spell.name: Erase Identity
entries: You place your hand on a creature's head, uttering words in an ancient language. The creature you touch must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's memories begin to drain from it over the course of 1 minute.
After a minute has passed, you let go of the creature, who then suffers from the following effects:

items: The creature forgets its own name, if it had one.
The creature forgets all personal memories, but retains all of its common knowledge, such as how to walk, eat, and speak Common.

The creature fails to recognize that it has any class features, special abilities, skill proficiencies, or any magical equipment attuned to it, and thus will not make any use of these features unless it relearns how to use them.

entries: For 24 hours after this spell has been cast, the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks, and all Charisma based skill checks made against it are made at advantage. After this time, the creature is free to make decisions and actions, as well as filling in the gaps in its mind, on its own based on the information presented to them.

Examples of ways in which a creature can be while under the effects of this spell might be that the creature swaps to an opposing side in a war, proceeds to follow and serve another creature, or begin to believe that their life has a new purpose. If the creature had any class features or special abilities, the creature can learn to use them again if taught how to do so.
A remove curse or greater restoration spell cast on the target using a 9th level spell slot restores the creature's lost memories.

spell.name: Genuine's Atomic Annihilation
entries: You summon forth pulsating atomic energy in an 80-foot cube within range. Each target within the affected area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 40d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, its atomic structure collapses and it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, even magic items of rarity Rare or lower, are obliterated and nothing remains of them. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

This spell automatically obliterates a nonmagical object or creation of magical force within the affected area. If a target is only partially occupying the affected area, only the section of the target within the area of the spell is affected by the spell's effects. A magic item of rarity Very Rare or higher is unaffected by this spell, but loses its magical properties for {@dice 1d6} days.

The physical stress of casting this spell weakens you. After you finish casting this spell, you must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion}, or only one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a successful one. This {@condition exhaustion} can't be reduced or prevented in any way. The {@condition exhaustion} lasts for {@dice 2d6} days.

spell.name: Six Plagues of Rashimond

components.m: twelve rat tails, a vial of sewage water, and a vial of blood

entries: You summon forth a mighty series of six mighty plagues, centered on a point you can see and spreading to a radius of 360 feet. Dark green and black clouds fill the air, foul smells of decay and disease sail in the wind, and a low droning sound can be heard omnipresently. Each creature under the clouds (no more than 5,000 feet beneath the clouds) when they appear must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for 5 minutes. This is considered the first plague, the Plague of Black Poison.
Each round you maintain concentration on this spell, you conjure forth a different plague on your turn.

{@b Round 2-3, Second Plague: Plague of Dreaded Rats:} Thousands of rats swarm the ground, climbing and tearing at anything in their path. Each creature and object in the rat swarm's path take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

{@b Round 4-5, Third Plague: Plague of Stone Toads:} Toads and frogs rain down from the clouds. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn.

{@b Round 6-7, Fourth Plague: Plague of Green Lightning:} You summon forth six bolts of green lightning from the grounds to strike six creatures or objects of your choice beneath the clouds. A given creature or object can't be struck by more than one bolt. A struck creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage and {@damage 4d6} acid damage on failed save, and half as much on a success. A creature who fails their saving throw takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage at the start of their next turn for the remainder of the spell's duration.

{@b Round 8-9, Fifth Plague: Plague of Blackened Veins:} Boils and blackened vein-like marks begin to appear on exposed flesh of creatures under the clouds. A creature under the clouds must make a Constitution saving throw against this disease. The creature takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage and {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success. A creature who fails their saving throw has disadvantage on Charisma checks for the remainder of the spell's duration.

{@b Round 10, Sixth Plague: Plague of Bloody Locusts:} Hundreds of thousands of blood covered locusts swarm in the area under the cloud. The area becomes difficult terrain and is heavily obscured. Each creature takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage. Ranged weapon attacks in the area are impossible. This swarm of bloody locusts count as a severe distraction for the purposes of maintaining concentration on spells. Finally, the swarms of locusts eat into any exposed crops, wood, cloth, or fabrics in the area.

spell.name: Stravard's Binding

m.text: a body part from the target of the spell, such as a strand of hair, a piece of skin, a nail, or blood, which is consumed, a bowl, and incense worth at least 25 gb, which is consumed

entries: Mixing the material components into a bowl, you set them on fire while uttering a string of arcane words as you attempt to bind a creature to a location so that it is cursed to never leave. While the material compnents are burning, choose a target as well as a location. The target must be within range, though the location does not have to, provided that you have been to that location before and can form a clear picture of it in your mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be cursed, permanently bound to the location of your choice.

While the target is cursed and bound to the location, the target can act and move around freely within an area of your choice between either a minimum of a 10-foot radius and a maximum of a 200-foot radius of the point the creature is target is bound to, the range of this radius being chosen at the casting of this spell. If the target attempts to move further than the set radius, the target is immediately pulled back by magic until within the bound radius.

Additionally, the target is unable to perform spells or other abilities or be affected by spell or other abilities that would enable the target to teleport or use any other means of extraplanar or planar travel.
A remove curse spell cast on the target using a 9th level spell slot ends this curse.

spell.name: The Gate of Obadiah

m.text: an ornate and intricate padlock worth at least 2500 gp and an ornate corresponding key worth at least 2500 gp

entries: You conjure forth a gate barricaded with chains, locks, and arcane seals. The gate either emerges from the ground, appears in a flash of light, or appears to emerge from a wall. The gate can appear as you wish, either as made of ornate wood, appearing as a prison cell door, or as a wrought iron gate, however the gate is 20 feet wide, 40 feet tall, and 5 feet deep, and appears dark within the gate should you look through it.
By turning the key into the padlock, you unbind the chains, locks, and arcane seals covering the front of the gate, and a deep rumbling sound is heard from within the gate itself.

You summon forth a creature of challenge rating 10 that emerges from the gate, which then disappears in a similar fashion as to how it was summoned. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends, at which point the gate re-emerges and draws the creature back within it before disappearing again.

The creature, regardless of its type, alignment, or intelligence, is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't violate its alignment. If you don't issue any commands to the creature, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

You have advantage on concentration checks to maintain this spell if either or both the key and padlock were made from or within a plane of existence where the summoned creature originates from, such as the Feywild or the Abyss. If your concentration is broken, the creature doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the creature, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and the creature regards all creatures that it can see as a threat. An uncontrolled creature can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it. The DM has the creature's statistics.

spell.name: The Tome of Aristrahan

m.text: a book bound in precious crystals, leather, metals, or wood and treated with oils worth at least 20,000 gp

entries: By means of this spell, you can bind a single creature into a prepared book, sustaining it in suspended animation and filling the book with its experience and knowledge that presents itself in a language of your choice. The tome's weight varies, as the tome has one page for every day of the bound subject's life. The cover and binding transform to reflect the subject's appearance, interests, and tastes. Every thought and memory, including those the target may have forgotten long ago, are perfectly transcribed within the enchanted pages, penned in incredible detail in both the language that the creature was thinking or speaking in when the event occurred and a language of your choice. If a memory includes dialogue in a language the subject didn't understand, that dialogue is written in the language it was spoken in. Any alterations to a subject's memories, such as by a spell or other magical effect, are presented in their true nature as well as an annotated section describing in detail the nature of the alteration.
Spells that modify or remove text have no effect on the contents of this book, save for effects granted by means of the wish spell.
A creature imprisoned by this spell automatically fails any saving throws against effects to change its memories or the text in the page.

A target bound by this spell can be freed only by means of the miracle or wish spell, or by uttering a special phrase that you assign to the book. This phrase can be in any language, and must be under twenty five words long. This spell makes the imprisoning tome supernaturally durable (AC 28, 10 hp per HD the imprisoned creature had). Destroying the tome immediately slays the creature imprisoned within, and all memories the creature had are lost.

spell.name: Yune's Greater Demiplane

m.text: a powder composed of diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire dust worth at least 15,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You create an ethereal door on a flat solid surface that you can see within range. The door is large enough to allow Large creatures to pass through unhindered. When opened, the door leads to a demiplane. The demiplane can be up to a 1 mile diameter sphere, within which the appearance can be decided by the caster. You choose the weather, terrain, flora, fauna, and any kind of lodging and structures that occupies the demiplane. Creatures can live within the demiplane, provided they have the food and supplies to do so.

Crops and other flora can grow like normal, and the caster can choose to allow seasons to change, or to have only one season. While you can create only simple animals and plants when you first cast this spell. However, you can plant crops and other flora from outside of this demiplane within it, and it can grow. You can also bring in outside fauna and other creatures to reside within this plane as well.

By means of this spell, this demiplane can be hidden away, safe from detection for the duration. The demiplane can't be targeted by divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors created by the divination of spells. Additionally, you, and any creature of your choice can learn the password to get into the demiplane.
When the spell ends, the door disappears, and any creatures or objects inside the demiplane remain trapped there, as the door also disappears from the other side.

Each time you cast this spell, you can create a new demiplane, or have the shadowy door connect to a demiplane you created with a previous casting of this spell. Additionally, if you know the nature and contents of a demiplane created by a casting of this spell by another creature, as well as the password set by the casting of this spell by another creature, you can have the ethereal door connect to its demiplane instead.
This spell can only be dispelled by the caster, or by means of the wish spell.

spell.name: Zalathar's Moment of Reckoning

m.text: a small stone carving of a purple worm, which is consumed

entries: Uttering a phrase of arcane words, you hold aloft the stone carving as it crumbles in your hands. At the moment it crumbles, gigantic worms made of stone and earth, each with a gaping mouth filled with row upon row of massive sharp teeth emerge out of the ground at six different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 14d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 14d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Creatures of size Large or smaller who are reduced to 0 hit points by the above damage are swallowed by the massive stone worms, along with any non-magical structures in the affected area. The massive stone worms retreat back into the earth at the end of the spell, and become massive piles of stone, rock, and earth.
Creatures and structures swallowed by the stone worms are buried amongst the rubble, other swallowed creatures and structures, and the remnants of the stone worms in areas from which they emerged.

spell.name: Zothari's Forbidden Ritual

components.m: at least one soul of a sapient, humanoid mortal being and a small knife

entries: Considered to be one of the most taboo spells ever created, this spell grants longevity, youth, and power to those who use it. By having the body of a mortal humanoid creature who is {@condition unconscious} as a sacrifice, you attempt to draw their life force and soul into yourself. While performing this ritual, you carve a small circular ring into your flesh, chanting a vile arcane phrase. Until this spell is complete, you are unable to cast any other spell, and cannot be affected by any other spell, or this spell ends.

After 1 hour, if the sacrifice has not woken up, it's soul leaves it's body and is absorbed into your own. The creature's soul cannot be retrieved by any means save for the wish spell, and you gain the following benefits:
Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 24, and you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.
You cannot be aged magically, and your lifespan is increased by 100 years. You also appear youthful and beautiful.

For every soul you absorb, your lifespan increases by an additional 100 years. When a soul is retrieved by means of the wish spell, you automatically lose all benefits granted by this spell, and your lifespan decreases by 100 years for every soul retrieved. If all souls absorbed by you are retrieved, you immediately die, crumbling into dust and ash, and your soul is destroyed.

trait.name: Caterpillar Climb
entries: The massive caterpillar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The massive caterpillar makes two attacks: one with its bite, one with its slam

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Constructed Companion

ac.special: The AC of the heavy armor you used to create this construct

hp.special: Your wizard level plus your Intelligence modifier, multiplied by 5

languages: and write every language you speak

trait.name: Might of the Master
entries: {@hit 1} to hit, damage, and skill checks. This bonus increases by 1 each time your proficiency bonus increases.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The constructed companion is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the constructed companion must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the constructed companion remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

trait.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Whenever you gain the Ability Score Improvement class feature, your companion's abilities also improve. Your companion can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or it can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, your companion can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature unless its description specifies otherwise.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The constructed companion makes two melee attacks. (Your constructed companion gains this feature when you reach 6th level)

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Protect Creator
entries: If you are the target of a melee attack and your constructed companion is within 5 feet of the attacker, you can use your reaction to command it to respond, using its reaction to make a melee attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The butterfly doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sense
entries: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Perception +3
entries: Senses Tremorsense 5 ft., passive Perception 12
Languages——Challenge 0

action.name: Needles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The hummingbird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Climber
entries: The koala has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks that rely on climbing.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The monkey can take the Disengage, Dodge, or Dash action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Paw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The moth has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on sight

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The rabbit has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The teacup pig has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: Melee Weapon attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 feet, one creature. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The turtle can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

subclass.name: Way of the Esoteric Ki
subclassFeatures: Way of the Esoteric Ki|Monk||Esoteric Ki|YAG|3

subclassFeature.name: Acoustics
entries: You are a wizard who focuses on the study of sound, and tries to understand the nature of sound waves and vibrations that are present in all things. Followers of this tradition of Acoustics, often called Acousticians or Sound Sages, often prefer spells that can manipulate sound, and believe that all things have a ‘perfect harmony' that they aim to tune themselves to, and that the incorrect vibrations within the heart or soul can lead to imbalance. Many of these wizards are musicians, avid linguists, or public speakers, but can also be found in unique roles within a military, or trying to mold the earth with the power of sound and vibrations.

subclassFeature.name: Vocal Savant
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have became adept at manipulating sound. You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy|phb} cantrip.
Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can expend one additional 1st level spell slot to cast the spell without using verbal components.

subclassFeature.name: Discombobulation
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have learned how to affect a creature's center of balance by manipulating sound. As an action, choose a number of creatures that you can see within 10 feet of you. If the target can hear you, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or be deafened until the end of your next turn, as you emit a noise that discombobulates it. Each deafened creature's speed drops to 0, and each creature drops any items or objects that it is carrying.

On subsequent turns, you can use your action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of your next turn. However, the effect ends if you move more than 5 feet away from the creature, if the creature can neither see nor hear you, or if the creature takes damage.
Once the effect ends, or if the creature succeeds on its initial saving throw against this effect, you can't use this feature on that creature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Echolocation
entries: At 6th level, you have learned how to locate creatures via sound. As a bonus action, you can gain blindsight up to 60 feet by attuning to sounds and vibrations. This effect lasts until the beginning of your next turn, and you cannot use this effect while deafened.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fine Tuning
entries: By 10th level, you have attuned to the might of sonic waves. You gain resistance to thunder damage, and you gain immunity to the deafened condition.

Additionally, you add the silence spell to your spellbook, if it is not there already. You can cast silence without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you cast the spell centered on you and it moves with you, though you can still cast spells with verbal components while this spell is active. Casting silence in this way shortens the duration of the spell to 1 minute while maintaining concentration.
Once you cast silence in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Piano & Forte
entries: At 14th level, you have mastered the art of sound manipulation. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you can remove or amplify the sound the spell makes.
If you remove the sound, the spell is cast silently.

If you amplify the sound, creatures hit by the spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes thunder damage equal to your wizard level and is deafened until the end of their next turn, and takes half as much damage on a success. Creatures within 300 feet can hear the spell.
You can use both of these features once per short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arbormancy
entries: There exist a handful of wizards who believe that there exists a fifth element, wood, that stands alongside the traditional elements of fire, air, earth, and water. Known as arbormancers or wood mages, these wizards view wood as embodying warmth, cooperation, and strength, and favor spells that incorporate wood. Many of these wizards study in forests, sometimes working alongside druids or fey.

subclassFeature.name: Wooden Familiarity
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have spent a considerable time studying the power of the element of wood. You gain proficiency in woodcarver's tools and you learn the {@spell shillelagh|phb} cantrip, and it does not count towards the total number of wizard cantrips that you know.

Additionally, whenever you summon a familiar, either by way of the {@spell find familiar|phb} or {@spell Yune's find greater familiar|yag} spell, you can choose to have your familiar's type become plant.

subclassFeature.name: Arborous Magic
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you have unlocked the magic of nature and wood. Whenever you gain a wizard level, you can replace one of the wizard spells you add to your spellbook with a druid spell, provided that it belongs to the schools of conjuration or transmutation. The spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Any druid spell you gain from this feature is considered a wizard spell for you, but other wizards can't copy druid spells from your spellbook into their own spellbooks. Note: You cannot aquire the healing spirit spell with this feature.

Whenever you cast a druid spell acquired from this feature, your AC increases by 2 until the beginning of your next turn, as magical wooden bark covers you. You cannot gain this benefit while wearing medium or heavy armor or be wielding a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Forested Strength
entries: By 6th level, much like the trees in the forests, you work best when in cooperation with your allies. Whenever you or one or more of your allies within 15 feet of you is subject to an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant you or your allies to add your Intelligence modifier to the saving throw.
You can use this ability a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence modifier. This range ncreases to 30 feet at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Wooden Elemental
entries: At 10th level, you have learned how to summon creatures made of wood and bark to aid you in battle. Over the course of 1 minute, you use several pieces of bark and leaves as the material components to summon either a shambling mound or a wood woad. This summoned creature cooperates with you and your allies with the same rules for conjure elemental. At 14th level, you can use this feature to summon a treant.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Woodcraft Mastery
entries: At 14th level, you have a mastery over the element of wood. Whenever you use your Forested Strength feature, you and your allies become covered in a protective layer of bark that provides them with a bonus to their AC equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Knight
entries: In lands filled with warfare and strife, special wizards known as Arcane Knights rise up to meet the call to battle. Followers of this unique tradition of Arcane Knights focus their studies drawing forth arcane energy to enhance their strength in a special blend of magic called their War Form, that aids them with incredible might and power that can allow them to enter the fray alongside other soldiers and warriors.

subclassFeature.name: Combative Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this tradition at 2nd level, you have become trained in the art of warfare. You gain proficiency in light, medium, and heavy armor, as well as melee martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: War Form
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can enter into a magical combative state known as your War Form. It empowers you with incredible defense, might, and strength.

You can use a bonus action to start the War Form, which lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated or reduced to 0 hit points, or if you don a different set of armor, or wield a different shield or weapon. You can also dismiss your War Form at any time you choose (no action required).
While your War Form is active, you gain the following benefits:
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expeded uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Warfare
entries: Starting at 6th level, while your War Form is active, when you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Combat
entries: By 10th level, you have become adept at fighting while casting spells. While you maintain concentration on a spell, once per turn, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your weapon's damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane War Form
entries: By 14th level, you have learned how to infuse arcane energy into your War Form. Whenever you first summon forth your War Form, you can choose one of the following effects. Each effect lasts for the duration of your War Form.
